No. 261368)} Sub: Advance Planning Sanction' of the   projects   awaiting Administrative and Financial sanction from Standing Finance Committee (SFC) Government of India reg: Administrative and Financial sanction of the Competent Authority is hereby conveyed for incurring DPR Activity expenditure relating to the Project subject to the limits and the total limits specified below: Name of the Project Head of Expenditure Amount of Sanction (Rs. in crore) DPR Total Sanction (Rs. In crore) 2_ These sanctions will be granted for advance planning of Project and to meet the expenditure on DPR activity for which approval of the SFC /Government is awaited. The budget for above sanction shall be provided from the contingency head of NHAI Budget for current Financial Year. Once the approval of the MoRTH is obtained, the above sanction and the expenditure against this sanction shall be subsumed into the specific project sanction issued by the Competent Authority in the Government. Therefore, while preparing the estimate for sanction of the Project by the SFC/ Government, Technical Division concerned must in-corporate the Total DPR Planning expenditure" and the expenditure made s0 far against such sanction_ 3. The above sanction will be granted subject to the following conditions: a The expenditure on DPR Activity should not exceed the 'Advance Planning Sanction b. Data Lake team shall create a temporary "Planning UPC" enabling the AFMS to capture such sanction and expenditure in the NHAI books and to monitor flow of expenditure against this sanction. C_ On receipt of regular sanction from the SFC/ Government, the temporary Planning UPC shall be converted into a full-fledged regular UPC by the Data Lake team as per the extant procedure for creation of UPC and expenditure on the project against this sanction shall subsume into the final sanction and future expenditure to be incurred. d. As and when approval of the SFC/Government is received, that sanction must be communicated to finance for incorporation in AFMS. Contd_2I - 7t 7 # NHAI 28th
